column4: BRIEF-Jabil Inc Says Withdrawing FY20 Full Year Guidance
column6: * Q2 REVENUE $6.1 BILLION VERSUS REFINITIV IBES ESTIMATE OF $6.16 BILLION
column7: * Q2 EARNINGS PER SHARE ESTIMATE $0.64 -- REFINITIV IBES DATA
column8: * FACTORIES WERE ADVERSELY IMPACTED BY WORKFORCE AND SUPPLY CHAIN DISRUPTIONS ASSOCIATED WITH COVID-19
column9: * “DESPITE NEAR-TERM FINANCIAL SETBACK, OUR LONG-TERM STRATEGY REMAINS UNCHANGED”
column10: * Q2 EXPENSES DIRECTLY ASSOCIATED WITH BUSINESS INTERRUPTION CAUSED BY COVID-19 WERE ABOUT $53 MILLION Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:

column4: Jabil sees profit hit from coronavirus
column5: Feb 25 (Reuters) - Apple supplier Jabil Inc said on Tuesday that its second-quarter earnings will be hit by the coronavirus epidemic.
column6: The coronavirus outbreak, which has resulted in more than 2,600 deaths in mainland China, has pushed a number of companies including the iPhone maker to warn of a profit hit as they grapple with disruptions in the global supply chain.
column7: Jabil said its factories were running at roughly 65%-70% capacity as the epidemic continues to spread. The company is estimated to report revenue of $6.33 billion in the second quarter, according to IBES data from Refinitiv. (Reporting by Amal S in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D’Silva)

column4: Jabil sees no improvement in margins until 2021
column5: (Reuters) - Contract electronics manufacturer Jabil Inc JBL.N said on Tuesday it does not expect any improvement in margins until 2021 as it spends more to fuel growth, sending its shares down nearly 10 percent.
column6: “We assume that from FY19 to FY21, we’ll get no expansion, no leverage of margin,” Chief Executive Officer Mark Mondello said on a post-earnings conference call.
column7: Shares of the Apple Inc AAPL.O supplier fell 9.5 percent to $27.23 in early trading, reversing from a near 5 percent gain premarket following a better-than-expected revenue and profit for the fourth quarter.
column8: Contract manufacturers such as Jabil make most of their equipment in China and sell to clients in the United States, making them vulnerable to the ongoing tariff war between the world’s two largest economies. The company earned about 21 percent of its total revenue from China in fiscal year 2017.
column9: “You wake up one day and there’s a tweet. You wake up 48 hours late, something else is going on,” Mondello said on the trade war, adding the company is well-positioned if tariff issues end with some ‘reasonable resolution’ over time.
column10: Jabil on Tuesday said gains in fourth-quarter revenue were largely due to growth in its higher-margin diversified manufacturing services business that caters to the consumer products industry.
column11: Revenue from the business, which includes supplies to Apple, rose 23 percent in fiscal 2018.
column12: The company reported a loss of $57.3 million, or 34 cents per share, in the quarter ended Aug. 31, compared with a profit of $45.7 million, or 25 cents per share, a year earlier.
column13: Revenue rose 15 percent to $5.77 billion, beating estimates of $5.43 billion.
column14: (This version of the story has been refiled to correct syntax in paragraph 4)

column4: Jabil sees no improvement in margins until 2021
column5: Sept 25 (Reuters) - Contract electronics manufacturer Jabil Inc said on Tuesday that it did not expect any improvement in margins until 2021, sending its shares down 8 percent.
column6: “We assume that from FY19 to FY21, we’ll get no expansion, no leverage of margin,” Chief Executive Officer Mark Mondello said on a post-earnings conference call.
column7: Shares of the Apple Inc supplier fell 7.9 percent to $27.71 in early trading, reversing from a near 5 percent gain premarket following better-than-expected revenue and profit for the fourth quarter. (Reporting by Akanksha Rana in Bengaluru; Editing by Sriraj Kalluvila)
